results.title: Children of the Sun
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which tells of the fun, pleasures and growing-up of a happy child. Also portrays the story of the unhappy child and stresses the need of U.N.I.C.E.F.’s assistance in providing health and happiness.

results.title: Children of Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film is designed to enable pupils to make a direct comparison with their own way of life, in order to help them towards a better understanding of the influence of environment on a people’s way of life. The children of a typical Swiss mountain farming family are introduced at work and at play. Directly recorded conversations in the Swiss language are featured in the film.

results.title: Children of Shatila
results.brief_description: The Palestinian plight is a sad one. The consequences of the partition of Palestine in 1948 and the Israeli occupation of the West Bank and the Gaza Strip in 1967 still reverberate around the world today. More than 350,000 Palestinian refugees have found their way to Lebanon where, however, they are denied resident status and access to over 70 professions by the Lebanese Government. The establishment of Shatila Camp in Beirut has become home to more than 15,000 Palestinians and Lebanese who share a common experience of displacement, unemployment and poverty. In 1982, Shatila made international news when more than 2,800 men, women and children were massacred by Israeli soldiers who had invaded Lebanon and occupied Beirut. This is the story of two Palestinian children born and raised in the Shatila Camp - Farah aged 11 and Issa aged 12. Both children’s grandparents were exiles from Palestine fifty years ago and it is the intent of documentary filmmaker Mai Masri to present the children’s stories of the realities of life in Shatila through their own eyes and words, providing each child with a video camera. Farah and Issa are delightful in their naturalness and through their own personal narratives about family background and daily life and interviews with family and friends, there is a sense that for all the poverty, tragedy and death that surrounds them, the girls are amazingly pragmatic in their attitude. However, it is every Palestinian’s dream to return home and maybe it is this dream which keeps alive the hope and the resourcefulness of the younger generation of Shatila. The film is a fragmentation of images by Farah, Issa and Mai Masri put together to present a heart-warming story in a heart-breaking environment. In English and Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Children of Scotland
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A survey of life in a Scottish fishing village on the Firth of Forth, showing through the eyes of children, the work of the fishermen. Pictures the children in their homes, and on a visit to a large fish market and to a shipbuilding town on the coast. Includes scenes of the ruins of a castle, recalling Scotland’s romantic past.

results.title: Children of Samoa
results.creator_credit: John Anderson, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the lifestyle of two children and their family, who live in a small village in Western Samoa. They are seen having school lessons, fishing, participating in traditional play activities, evening prayers, food preparation and a feast.

results.title: Children of revolution
results.brief_description: Presents impressions of youth in Czechoslovakia: the life of those born since 1948, with scenes of children in day nurseries and schools, and in more detail the daily life, employment and recreation of young workers. Discusses their behaviour and attitudes and shows that although most public activities are officially controlled, there is much personal independence, indifference to politics and interest in Western popular music and fashions. This is contrasted with the former popular support of the regime and identification with it expressed in the moribund Volunteer Youth Brigades. Written and narrated by Robert Kee.

results.title: Children of Japan
results.brief_description: A study of the daily life of a middle-class Japanese family immediately before World War II. The contrast between the influence of Western technology and the traditional customs and habits of the Japanese people is reflected in their environment.
results.description: A study of the daily life of a middle-class Japanese family immediately before World War II. The contrast between the influence of Western technology and the traditional customs and habits of the Japanese people is reflected in their environment.

results.title: Children of Hong Kong
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of a young boy Ying Kit, and his extended family in Hong Kong. The family live in a houseboat and the program looks at various aspects of his life such as school, family relationships, chores and food.
